2 other instances of connection pool are explicitly created (connPool and connPoolMutex) in TxnHandler https://github.com/apache/hive/blob/035eca39fc0bd7aa0d9c1809a26e000ac52978d0/standalone-metastore/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/metastore/txn/TxnHandler.java#L256-L264 

If datanucleus.connectionPool.maxPoolSize is set to 10, then hive will create 47 (connPoolMutex creates 7 more than maxPoolSize) connections per HS2 and HMS instance. This blows up the number of connections on DB side. Ideally, we want a single shared connection pool for ObjectStore and TxnHandler so that it is easily tuneable.
